emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that adapt to real-time data and user needs, reducing the need for human intervention in contract execution.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances efficiency and trust in digital agreements but raises concerns about AI biases and security.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, technical standards, and integration with existing legal frameworks.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Space Operations
emerging_technologies.description: Utilization of blockchain for managing space missions, ownership of space assets, and resource distribution.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could democratize space exploration but might lead to jurisdictional disputes in space.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: International agreements, cost-effectiveness, and the need for secure, transparent operations in space.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Cognitive Enhancements
emerging_technologies.description: Neural enhancement technologies where individuals can trade or earn tokens for cognitive improvements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential to reduce inequality in cognitive abilities but introduces ethical concerns regarding cognitive equity.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Public perception, ethical guidelines, and the integration with educational and health systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Grid Management
mainstream_technologies.description: Blockchain-based systems for managing electricity distribution, enhancing grid resilience and integration of renewable sources.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in regions with advanced energy policies, facing resistance in areas with established centralized energy systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: Zero-Knowledge Applications
mainstream_technologies.description: Applications that ensure privacy through zero-knowledge proofs, now mainstream in areas requiring high data privacy.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integrated into financial services, healthcare, and identity verification systems for enhanced security and privacy.

epoch_themes.description: A move towards systems where trust is built into the technology rather than centralized entities.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes transparency, reduces corruption, but challenges traditional governance models.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing push for data sovereignty, privacy laws, and anti-monopoly regulations.

epoch_themes.description: AI's role in decision-making processes at various levels of governance, from contracts to space exploration.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Enhances decision quality but might automate away human oversight, necessitating new ethical frameworks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rising discussions on AI ethics, transparency, and accountability in governance.
